summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Jeffrey Epstein on charges of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy. It alleges Epstein, with the help of employees and associates, sexually exploited dozens of underage girls in New York and Florida between 2002 and 2005, using a scheme where victims were paid to recruit others.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Charged with sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy. Allegedly sexually exploited dozens of underage girls between 2002-2005 in New York and Florida, using a network where victims recruited others.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the press release announcing Epstein's arrest and charges. Made a statement condemning the alleged crimes and affirming the office's commitment to the victims.

persons.name: James P. O'Neill
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Joined in announcing the charges, commended law enforcement partners, and stated the NYPD's commitment to eradicating child trafficking.

persons.name: Henry B. Pitman
persons.context: Epstein was expected to be presented before this judge in Manhattan federal court on the afternoon of the press release.

persons.name: Richard M. Berman
persons.context: The case was assigned to this judge for further proceedings.

connections.description: Epstein allegedly worked with employees and associates to contact victims, schedule sexual encounters, and facilitate his abuse scheme.
Epstein is accused of sexually exploiting and abusing dozens of underage girls, paying them for sex acts and to recruit other victims.
Certain victims were allegedly paid by Epstein to recruit additional underage girls for him to abuse, creating a network.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on Saturday, July 6, 2019.

events.title: Indictment Unsealed and Charges Announced
events.description: The indictment charging Epstein with sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy was unsealed and announced in a press release.

events.title: Alleged Sex Trafficking Scheme
events.description: The period during which Epstein allegedly enticed and recruited dozens of minor girls to engage in sex acts with him in New York and Florida.

locations: New York, New York (specifically his mansion/residence on the Upper East Side)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was charged with one count of sex trafficking of minors (max 40 years) and one count of conspiracy to engage in sex trafficking of minors (max 5 years).
The alleged scheme operated from at least 2002 to 2005, involving dozens of victims as young as 14 years old.
Epstein allegedly used a network where he paid certain victims to recruit other underage girls, creating a steady supply of new victims.
The abuse allegedly occurred at Epstein's residences in Manhattan's Upper East Side and in Palm Beach, Florida, under the guise of 'massages' that escalated into sex acts.
Epstein worked with employees and associates who facilitated the scheme by contacting victims and scheduling encounters.
